THIS SUNDAY: Can’t Stop The Serenity returns!

Posted on June 22, 2012June 22, 2012 by sarahgiffrow

This Sunday, PGC3 member organization PDX Browncoats is bringing back its annual Can’t Stop The Serenity event for its 7th Year in action! This year, PDX Browncoats will be screening Joss Whedon’s beloved classic, Serenity, as well as Firefly episode, ‘Out of Gas,’ with a fantastic bash at the Bagdad Theater in Portland. PDX Browncoats has a proud history of supporting non-profits that promote equality for men and women, raising over $400,000 of support within the past four years, and in their continuing tradition of geeky, non-profit do-gooding, all proceeds from this year’s Can’t Stop The Serenity will go to support some fine organizations!

From their press release:

Can’t Stop the Serenity (CSTS) is a great way to both indulge your geeky side and do some good. Beginning in 2006, fans have organized worldwide screenings of Joss Whedon’s Serenity to raise funds and awareness for Equality Now and their work for the protection and promotion of the human rights of women around the world. This year, Portland’s event will also support Raphael House with a portion of the proceeds raised.

Doors will open for pre-sale ticket holders at 12:30 pm on Sunday June 24th. Pre-sale ticket holders can get their seats, order food, peruse raffle items, and enjoy the melodies of the geeky duo, The Doubleclicks. At 1:30 pm doors will open for day of ticket buyers. The show kicks off at 2:00 pm with the Firefly episode ‘Out of Gas’ before the screening of Serenity. Make sure to get your raffle tickets and break out your best brown coat for our raffle and costume contest between the episode and the movie.

You can snag advance tickets online to get access to the pre-show, tell all your friends about it through the Can’t Stop The Serenity Facebook event, or learn more about PDX Browncoats on their web site, and the organizations they’re benefitting.

7th Annual Can’t Stop The Serenity
Sunday, June 24th, 2012
Pre-show at 12:30pm, Show at 2:00pm ($12 advance, $15 at-the-door)
Bagdad Theater
3702 SE Hawthorne Blvd 

CONTRIBUTOR: Sarah Giffrow is the owner of Sarah Giffrow Creative, offering design, photography, and web site geekery for Portland small businesses. She also plays roller derby, knows kung fu, and has quite possibly been to more Star Trek conventions than you.

TFAW presents Adventure Time Comics signing

Posted on June 19, 2012June 22, 2012 by ruckuslauren

From TFAW:

Boom! Studios’ Adventure Time comics have been a huge hit, selling out nationwide, and Things From Another World (TFAW) is excited to host a signing at their Portland location this Saturday from 1 to 3 p.m., featuring Chris Roberson and his Adventure Time co-writer, his eight-year-old-daughter Georgia! Come out to pick up your copy of Adventure Time #5 and get it signed. Free soda and juice provided.

The Adventure Time comics are based on Cartoon Network’s insanely popular animated show! The series follows the adventures of Finn, a 14-year old boy in the Land of Oo whose best friend is Jake, a dog with magical powers such as growing and shrinking or stretching into many shapes. Finn is a silly kid who wants to become a great hero one day. He might not look too tough, but if there’s evil around, he’ll slay it!

Chris Roberson is a critically acclaimed writer who’s written for a wide range of comics, including Cinderella: Fables Are Forever, Star Trek/Legion of Superheroes, and his creator-owned title, Memorial.

Portland TFAW, 2916 NE Broadway Portland, OR 97232
Saturday, June 23 from 1 to 3 p.m.
RSVP on Facebook

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.

Matthew Clark’s “Wishing You Were Here but… Having A MARVELous Time!”

Posted on June 4, 2012July 23, 2012 by ruckuslauren

From the Sequential Art Gallery:

Gallery friend and regularly featured artist Matthew Clark will be returning in June with all new original comics art in: Wishing You Were Here but… Having A MARVELous Time! A year ago professional comic book artist Matthew Clark joined with Marvel Entertainment, and in that time has gotten to draw pages for some of comics fan’s favorite books. Sequential Art Gallery will be showcasing original pencilled and inked pages from his work on Amazing Spider-Man and Avenging Spider-Man, Punisher, and Ghost Rider, which was relaunched under Matthew’s pencils. Original art and prints will be for sale at the gallery through the month of June.

Opens: First Thursday, June 7, 2012, 6-10pm
Closes: Saturday, June 30, 2012
Sequential Art Gallery + Studio
328 NW Broadway #113

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.

SATURDAY: Portland TFAW Grand Opening, plus Patric Reynolds!

Posted on June 1, 2012 by admin

You know that scene from Star Wars on the forest moon of Endor where the Ewoks are beating their drums in celebration and dancing in their tree houses? This is an apt image to keep in mind when thinking of the grand opening of the newest TFAW location in Portland.

This Saturday, TFAW opens its newest location in North Portland, complete with an exclusive after-hours party starting at 7 pm. The night of revelry will be complete with free food, complimentary beer (for those 21+ with ID), and a reception for artist Patric Reynolds’ Black & White Gallery Exhibition.

The new location boasts twice the space, a greater selection, and extra floor room for events, gallery showings, signings and more.

This from TFAW:

“As a thank you to our customers, we’re offering 20% off everything in the store June 2 and 3, and folks who move their subscription boxes with us–or start a new one in June–will receive a $10 gift certificate as a thank you, to use in July.”

Doors open at 11 am, the Grand Opening shindig starts at 7pm. Details about this event can be found via the Facebook Event–let your friends know you’re coming!

Erin May Davis is a Marketer, Graphic Designer and lover of all things Portland. View her full portfolio of work at www.erinmaydavis.com, or catch up on her latest exploits on her blog.

Be a costumed extra for Revolver Digital Media Studio

Posted on May 28, 2012 by sarahgiffrow

If you like dressing spectacularly and being part of film productions, don your masks and your finest masquerade wear, and be a part of a music video shoot by Revolver Digital Media Studio this coming Saturday.

From their press release:

Beloved by fans for his bluesy/soulful vocals, stick-in-your-head melodies, and high energy shows, singer, songwriter, and musician Roshan Maloney has gained the reputation of a serious double-threat performer.

Revolver Digital Media Studio (Revolver DMS) partnered with Roshan in 2011 to produce a music video for his hot single “Run Out of Luck”. The video received positive reviews from both critics and fans for its energetic cuts and warm imagery. A little over a year has past and we’ve decided to produce a more ambitious video with higher stakes and a
closely guarded story line. One scene in the video takes place at a concert during a masquerade ball and we need several extras to attend in the proper attire. Details for the shoot are below; if you’d like to attend please email the producer to receive proper instructions and your confirmation for the shoot.

Breakdown: We’re shooting in a ballroom; it’s a masquerade event so we ask that you dress appropriately. Your attendance will add great production value to the video and mean a lot to everyone involved.

We’ll run through a couple of scenes several times, food is currently being arranged for all who attend.

Time/Date:
Shooting will take place between 09:00 a.m. and 07:00 p.m. on Saturday June 2nd

Address:
West End Ballroom
1220 SW Taylor St., Portland, Oregon 97205

Everything you need to know about the performer: http://www.roshanmaloney.com/index.html

Revolver’s music video work can be viewed at the following web address for a reference of our quality: www.revolverdms.com

If you’d like more information about this project or to submit a resume, please call 503.268.9520 or email Benjamin at bjames@revolverdms.com

SUNDAY: Take Shelter from the End of Humanity with Critical Hit Burlesque!

Posted on May 25, 2012July 23, 2012 by ruckuslauren

All things must come to an end, but by studying those forces which might be arrayed against us, we can only hope to be better prepared to go out with a fight. Aliens!… zombies!… scientific experiments gone awry!… we must be prepared for any eventuality! Geeklesque: DESTROY ALL HUMANS is an all menace-to-mankind themed show, with acts based around science fiction “end of the world” scenarios from movies, video games, and pop culture.

Presented in association with Wonder Northwest 2012 at the Bossanova Ballroom, DESTROY ALL HUMANS will be one night only on Sunday, May 27th, 2012. Hosted by the Mad Marquis, DESTROY ALL HUMANS will feature a selection of new and familiar Geeklesque performers, including:

Angelique DeVil
Isaiah Esquire of Burlesquire
Fleur de Sel
from Seattle, Scarlett O’Hairdye
and from New Orleans, the Sister Wives: Hazel Mae and Bebe Baker!

Thanks to our fine sponsors, Guardian Games and PortLUG, the Portland Lego Users Group, for supporting our show!

SHOW DETAILS

Sunday, May 27, 2012
Bossanova Ballroom, 722 E. Burnside

Doors at 8:00pm / show at 9:00pm
21+ only

General Admission $12 advance / $15 at the door
Reserved Balcony Seating $20 advance (advance sale only)
$35 VIP reserved seating in the front section and two drink tickets! (advance sale only)

For advance sale tickets, go here.

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.

SATURDAY: Alter Egos Society’s Power Struggle!

Posted on May 25, 2012May 25, 2012 by sarahgiffrow

Portland’s premiere purveyors of costumed event fun, The Alter Egos Society, returns to the scene with its 5th Annual Hero/Villain Power Struggle, this time in conjunction with Wonder Northwest! This year, the Power Struggle will be making its way through pubs on Portland’s East side, making its final stop at the the official afterparty for Wonder Northwest, and the heroes and villains will vie for supremacy along the way.

The Alter Egos Society will also be continuing its awesome work with the community by holding a raffle during the Power Struggle, with all proceeds benefitting P:EAR. From their official events page:

Time to don your superest outfit again for The Alter Egos Society’s Fifth Annual Hero/Villain Power Struggle pub crawl. On Saturday, May 26th you can settle the score in the bars and on the streets of inner Southeast Portland. At 5pm heroes will begin to gather at one bar and villains at another. Choose your faction wisely because the two sides will meet for games and contests, battling for prizes and pride before the final destination. Come dressed as any alter ego of your own creation – that means original costumes only please!

This a free event, but bring cash for the bars and for raffle tickets that benefit P:EAR in their mission to mentor homeless youth. 21+ due to the nature of the event.

Alter Egos Society’s 5th Annual Hero/Villain POWER STRUGGLE:
May 26, 2012, begins at 5:00pm
HEROES meet at Hawthorne Hideaway (2221 SE Hawthorne Blvd)
VILLAINS meet at The Vern (2622 SE Belmont St)
21 and over, FREE 

Not sure what to expect? Check out a few photos from last year’s event, by Sarah G Creative:

CONTRIBUTOR: Sarah Giffrow is the owner of Sarah Giffrow Creative, offering design, photography, and web site geekery for Portland small businesses. She also plays roller derby, knows kung fu, and has quite possibly been to more Star Trek conventions than you.

Wonder Northwest This Weekend

Posted on May 23, 2012May 26, 2012 by ruckuslauren

About Wonder NW:

Wonder Northwest is an amalgamation of pop-culture subcultures. Here you will find regular folks co-mingling with super heroes, pirates, geeks, nerds, cosplayers, film enthusiasts, gamers and other nice people! Our vendor room will feature comic books, toys, video games and more from some of the best dealers from across the country.

Wonder Northwest is this weekend, May 26th and 27th, at the Crowne Plaza. Although advance registration is closed, tickets can be purchased at the door. $8 per day or $15 for the weekend.

Panelists from the PGC3 include Bobby Roberts of cortandfatboy in Nerdfight Live!!! and Kneel Before Pod II, Going Last Podcast moderating Out of the Basement: A discussion of organized play and gaming as a social event, Kaijucast, PDXYar in Under the Black Flag: Welcome Aboard El Tiburon!, and the PDX Browncoats for Whedon Trivia.

The official after party is the Alter Egos Power Struggle on Saturday night, a pub crawl beginning at the Hawthorne Hideaway if you’re a hero, or the The Vern on Belmont, if you’re a villain.

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.
Posted in Events, PGC3 News Tagged Alter Egos Society, Bobby Roberts, Cort and Fatboy, Going Last Podcast, Kaijucast, PDX Browncoats, PDXYar, WonderNW 1 Comment

The Geek Olympathon Returns!

Posted on May 9, 2012May 25, 2012 by admin

After delighting Portland with the debut of its Geek Olympathon last June, the Portland Geek Council of Commerce and Culture (PGC3) is proud to announce that the city-wide nerd-fest will return May 19! After forming a team of up to five members, participants will compete in geeky contests and events all over Portland in order to win fantastic prizes, including tickets and hotel accommodations for five to the world’s premier gaming festival, PAX Prime in Seattle from August 31-September 2. Both weekend and single-day passes to this convention have completely sold out, so you won’t want to miss out on this opportunity!

The Geek Olympathon will commence Saturday, May 19 at 9 a.m. at Backspace (115 NW 5th Ave) with opening ceremonies and a Racing the Tubes bike race sponsored by Old Town Computers. Backspace will also provide free house coffee and facilities for last-minute team registration. Individual events will run from 10 a.m. until 5 p.m. and be hosted in a number of locations in Portland. Entry is $25 for teams of up to five people or $5 per individual, and teams can register online at PGC3.org/Olympathon.

“We had such an enthusiastic response to the Geek Olympathon last year, we couldn’t wait to do it again,” said PGC3 Board Member and Olympathon Organizer Joshua Dommermuth. “We’ve been able to make it even better and more exciting this year–people are going to love it.”

This year’s events includes a mix of old favorites and new entries that are designed to utilize a variety of nerd skills. Competitors should be prepared to show their superior knowledge of comics, video games, television, movies, and pop culture. Hosted by PGC3 member organizations across Portland, not all competitions will require five members, which will enable teams to split up and compete in as many events as possible.

After the day’s events are over, participants will face the final competitions and be awarded prizes at the Awardathon, an epic celebration at the Eagles Lodge at 4904 SE Hawthorne from 8 p.m. to close. Here, teams will compete in a special edition of Things From Another World’s Geek Trivia with Cort Webber and Bobby Roberts of “cortandfatboy” before they are awarded prizes for their performance in the Olympathon, as well as bonus awards for overall participation.

In addition to a trip for five to PAX Prime, prizes include two Club-level tickets to a Portland Timbers game, as well as generous donations from Cognition the Robot Uprise, Geek Chic Cosmetics, Guardian Games, PDX YAR, Sock Dreams, Things From Another World, Old Town Computers, and more. A full schedule of events and the online form for team registration are available at PGC3.org/Olympathon.

CONTRIBUTOR: Elisabeth Forsythe works her marketing magic at Things From Another World, an excellent online comic shop chock-full of comic books and graphic novels. You can find her half-baked musings on comics and more at The Blog From Another World.

Posted in Events, PGC3 News Leave a comment

Tonight at Sequential Art Gallery: Star St. Germain’s “Date Lines”

Posted on May 3, 2012May 3, 2012 by ruckuslauren

From the Sequential Art Gallery:
In an art show that can’t be contained by mere picture frames, San Fransisco-based multimedia maven Star St. Germain presents: “Date Lines”.

Date Lines is 13 mixed media pieces (plus site-specific installation elements) exploring Star St.Germain's failed adventures in the San Francisco dating scene. Star's various suitors are represented as silhouettes, faceless testaments to all manner of sexy mistakes. The show is about finding hope amongst the most dismal of interactions--with hilarious results.

A tornado disguised as a girl, Star St. Germain has contributed comics to books like Comic Book Tattoo for Tori Amos/Image Comics, Strange Tales and Girl Comics for Marvel, and most recently, Womanthology for IDW. She plays cello and sings for several musical projects, launched ThisIsStar Jewelry, models, and co-hosts Destroy All Podcasts for Collection DX. She never sleeps. See more of her work at here.

Sequential Art Gallery, 328 NW Broadway #113
Opening Reception: May 3, 2012, 6-10pm
Runs Through: May 26, 2012

Star St. Germain podcasting at Stumptown Comics Fest 2011

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.
